page.title: 02Ashington By-Pass
page.content: At present our village suffers from very heavy traffic and for many years the villagers have hoped for a by-pass. The County Council have plans to build a new road but it will be at least 10 years before completion. The alternative is to have large housing developments, doubling the size of the village, and the developers would then provide Â£1.5m of the Â£2.25m needed. Ashington was chosen for development because it is situated on the main Horsham to Worthing A.24 road and has not had a great deal of building in recent years compared to other nearby towns. The developer will be allowed to build on 30 acres of land and the regulations state that he must build a variety of types of houses. The effect will be to increase the village by 1,100 people in the 450 new homes.
